Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
I read up on this a bit last week - https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Satoshi_Client_Node_Discovery
beyond setting up extra nodes personally with `connect=` pointing to NN, not sure IP hoarding  is possible. Excluding NN IPs ussing `setban` is possible, but not convinced it would be advantageous to the bad actor.

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: I noticed that when double notas happened, ususally half of the NN `bestk` are -1, and half of the `recvmask` & `bestmask` are 0

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it indicates that recvmask is diverging

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: some nodes are so much faster than others, that it splits the network into 2

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: @gt  that is also true from my observation

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Same here.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so increase minsigs to some stupid number... and see if it stops working... if it does you have the answer

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its not that nodes create their bestmask with each other... they create the recvmask with each other then you generate 2 diffrent best masks.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you will see that there are terrible nodes that exist that are so slow they hardly respond at all, and they still occasionaly notarize because enough node just saw them to get a random chance to enter bestmask

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: at least this is my understanding of how it works, I could be wrong but from a lot of ovbservation this seems to be the case.
